medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had been tired and anorectic for five years before admission, with joint aches and stiffness in the neck and shoulders. A diagnosis of polymyalgia rheumatica had been made, and she had refused prednisone. She reported persistent fatigue, poor appetite, and stiffness in the hands and knees 21 months before admission. Symptoms progressed to confusion and disorientation associated with an unwitnessed collapse and fever, leading to the discovery of a pituitary mass six months before admission.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Polymyalgia rheumatica, hyperlipidemia diagnosed six years before admission, depression following the death of her husband 12 years earlier, and a history of smoking two packs of cigarettes daily until two years prior to admission.
medical_history.social_history: Frequent travel within the United States to visit her daughters; previously a smoker, quitting two years before admission.
